com.topright.roboticon

Class PlotManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Group
        • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.WidgetGroup
          • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Table
            • com.topright.roboticon.PlotManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Cullable, com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.Layout

    public class PlotManager
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Table
    Manages all the plots and allows Players (both AI and human) to acquire plots and place roboticons on them

    Design decision: decided against having one class for the GUI portion of the plot manager and one to actually manage the plot objects (that the AI could interact with) as every interaction with a plot (whether by an AI player or a human player) requires to GUI to be updated

    Author:
    jcn509

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlotManager

        public PlotManager(java.lang.String backgroundImage,
                   Plot[][] plots,
                   Player humanPlayer,
                   Player AIPlayer)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        backgroundImage - A String that stores the file path of the background image (i.e. a picture of a map to be displayed behind the plots).
        plots - A 2D array of plots that the player can interact with
        humanPlayer - The human player who is playing the game.
        AIPlayer - The AI player that is competing against the human player.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlotButtons

        public ButtonWithIcon[][] getPlotButtons()
        Returns a 2D array containing all of the buttons that are clicked to interact with the various plots.

        Needed for testing purposes or for any code where the programmer wishes to simulate a button click.

        Returns:
        A 2D array containing all of the buttons that are clicked to interact with the various plots.

      • placeEnergyRoboticon

        public void placeEnergyRoboticon(int plotColumn,
                                 int plotRow)
        Tries to place an energy roboticon at the chosen plot
        Parameters:
        plotColumn - The column number of the plot
        plotRow - The row number of the plot

      • placeOreRoboticon

        public void placeOreRoboticon(int plotColumn,
                              int plotRow)
        Tries to place an ore roboticon at the chosen plot
        Parameters:
        plotColumn - The column number of the plot
        plotRow - The row number of the plot

      • removeRoboticonPlaceMenu

        public void removeRoboticonPlaceMenu()
        If a RoboticonPlaceMenu is open it will be closed

      • acquirePlot

        public void acquirePlot(int row,
                        int column)
        Called if a plot is to be acquired by the current player.

        If the plot is not currently owned by another player then it is acquired by the current player and a message is dispatched to let the main class know that this has happened.

        Parameters:
        row - The row number of the plot.
        column - The column number of the plot.

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(Player player)
        Set the current player (this information is needed by some other methods).
        Parameters:
        player - The current player.

      • setPlotClickMode

        public void setPlotClickMode(com.topright.roboticon.PlotClickMode mode)
        Sets what action will be performed when a plot is clicked.
        Parameters:
        mode - Specifies what action is to be performed when a plot is clicked.

      • produceResources

        public void produceResources()
        Triggers all plots to produce resources for their players.

      • allPlotsAquired

        public boolean allPlotsAquired()
        Returns true if every plot has already been acquired by some player.
        Returns:
        Whether or not every plot has already been acquired.

      • getPlots

        public Plot[][] getPlots()
        Returns the array of plots in use by this object

        Some other classes (e.g. the AIPlayer class) need this information

        Returns:
        The array of plots in use by this object
